holidays.name: International Mandela Day
holidays.description: A day dedicated to honoring Nelson Mandela's legacy by encouraging people to take action and inspire change through community service.
holidays.origin: Established by the United Nations in 2009 to celebrate Nelson Mandela's birthday and his contributions to peace and freedom.
holidays.funFact: Mandela Day urges everyone to spend 67 minutes doing good acts, symbolizing the 67 years Mandela spent fighting for social justice.

holidays.name: National Caviar Day (USA)
holidays.description: A day to indulge in and celebrate the luxury of caviar, the prized delicacy consisting of salted fish eggs.
holidays.origin: Unofficial food holiday created by seafood enthusiasts to appreciate caviar's 'royal' status in cuisine.
holidays.funFact: Caviar was once banned in the U.S. due to overfishing concerns but is now farmed sustainably, making it a rare treat.

holidays.name: World Listening Day
holidays.description: An awareness day encouraging people to be mindful of the sounds around them and explore how sound shapes our lives and environments.
holidays.origin: Started by the World Listening Project in 2007 to promote acoustic ecology and critical listening skills.
holidays.funFact: Participants often record and share soundscapes from their surroundings to highlight the world's sonic diversity.

holidays.name: Nelson Mandela International Day of Service
holidays.description: A lesser-known but quirky twist, some communities celebrate by doing ‘Mandela Madness’ dance events, combining activism with funky moves to raise awareness.
holidays.origin: Grassroots movement blending cultural dance with activism, inspired by Mandela's charismatic spirit.
holidays.funFact: These dance flash mobs have popped up in unexpected places like shopping malls and subway stations to spread joy and awareness.

holidays.name: Give Something Away Day
holidays.description: A fun, feel-good day to celebrate generosity by giving something you no longer need to a friend, neighbor, or stranger.
holidays.origin: Unofficial holiday encouraging selflessness and promoting minimalism through simple acts of giving.
holidays.funFact: Some people use this day to clear out clutter, turning giving into a fun treasure hunt for others!
